candidate_info.name: Reverend  William Black
candidate_info.background: Reverend William Black was a prominent figure in the African Nova Scotian community in New Brunswick. He served as a minister in the African Methodist Episcopal Church and was a vocal advocate for civil rights and social justice. He played a key role in the development of the Black community in the province.
candidate_info.cultural_context: Reverend William Black's  contributions to the Black community in New Brunswick are significant. His work as a minister and activist helped to shape the social and political landscape for African Nova Scotians in the province. His legacy continues to inspire  ongoing efforts to address racial inequality and promote inclusivity.
